p.s: The book had a huge impact on me and probably generally an impact for every reader, because it is so popular and sucessfulsuccessful.
The story is really interesting and realistic at the same time.
Normally I don't like to read books, but this one catched me and teached me a lot about racism.

Before I have just heard much about racism storysstories, after I have finally read this one, I can better imagine how unjust racism is, I learned that there is no reason to be a racist, there never was one.

I have only one critic, namely in the film is a scene where Starr scares Hailey with a hairbrush, because she acts racism, she deserved it for sure, but the problem is that, Starr was presented as the violent attacker and Hailey as the victim, so the black girl is again the attacker, whereas in this sequence the white girl Hailey should it be.
Apart from that the book is excellent.
